decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize cheap and efficient spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The use of cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with cards like Wrenn and Six, allow for consistent card selection and advantage. The mana base is specifically designed to support and maximize the effectiveness of the deck's spells and creatures while also providing disruption with cards like Wasteland.

The key concept of this Legacy Aggro deck is to utilize fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Chalice of the Void and Blood Sun to disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Goblin Rabblemaster, while also having control elements like Punishing Fire and Dead / Gone to deal with threats. Overall, the deck focuses on quick and efficient aggression while disrupting opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and casting burn spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they can stabilize. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear provide early aggression, while Chain Lightning, Exquisite Firecraft, Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, Fireblast, Lightning Bolt, and Price of Progress serve as efficient burn spells to close out the game quickly. The deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct damage spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, using low-cost spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells. It aims to control the board through tempo plays and card advantage, utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and True-Name Nemesis to quickly close out the game. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to all necessary colors and Wasteland provides additional disruption. Overall, this deck seeks to maintain a fast pace and dominate the board early on.

The main concept of this Dark Depths combo deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a Marit Lage token with indestructible protection from removal spells, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes ways to search for key combo pieces like Sylvan Scrying and Crop Rotation, along with protection against opposing cards with Pithing Needle and Not of This World. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently and consistently win the game through the Dark Depths combo.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and cheat powerful creatures into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand are the key combo pieces that can quickly win the game once they hit the battlefield. The deck also includes a lot of card draw and countermagic to help protect the combo and find the necessary pieces. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, allowing the deck to go off as early as possible.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, backed up by efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and countermagic like Force of Will. The goal is to apply pressure early on while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six to generate value and maintain card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to control the board and win the game through quick and efficient aggression.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing artifacts, then using card draw and selection spells to find and assemble the necessary combo pieces. It aims to cast a powerful spell like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells to control the opponent's hand and prevent them from interfering with the combo. Overall, the main strategy is to generate a storm of spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo as quickly and efficiently as possible, using cards like Thespian's Stage, Vampire Hexmage, and Crop Rotation to generate a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's resources, while cards like Tarmogoyf and Abrupt Decay provide additional threats and removal. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the combo and provide consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and efficiently using a combination of cheap, powerful creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis. Key spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, Daze, and Force of Will help maintain card advantage and disrupt opponents. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stifle to control the board and keep opponents on the back foot. The mana base is designed to support the three-color strategy and enable early disruption with Wasteland.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly deploying aggressive threats like Legion Warboss and Goblin Rabblemaster. The deck aims to lock opponents out of casting their spells with cards like Trinisphere and Fiery Confluence, while also generating card advantage and additional disruption with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck's strategy revolves around fast, disruptive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn using cards like Faithless Looting, Entomb, and Griselbrand. The deck then aims to bring these creatures back from the graveyard onto the battlefield using spells like Exhume and Animate Dead, creating a powerful board presence that can overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, cards like Unmask and Cabal Therapy help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also protecting the combo pieces of the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, allowing you to trigger abilities like Dredge and bring back creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba. The deck aims to generate value from sacrificing creatures with cards like Cabal Therapy and Bridge from Below, while also being able to generate mana with Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal. The combination of dredge abilities, graveyard recursion, and sacrificing creatures allows for explosive combo plays and overwhelming your opponent with a swarm of creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to lock down the opponent's lands with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port while also using powerful land combos like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate powerful threats. The deck also has strong card draw and recursion with Life from the Loam and Sylvan Library, allowing for consistent control and resource management. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through strategic land manipulation and efficient control cards.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using rituals and fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal. It uses cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to dig for combo pieces and disruption like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main goal is to assemble the Storm combo by casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate a lethal Tendrils of Agony. Graveyard recursion with Past in Flames and powerful draw effects with Ad Nauseam help ensure the deck can win in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Ashen Rider using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. It then uses reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring these creatures back into play for a game-winning combo. Cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual help to mana ramp and accelerate the reanimation process. The inclusion of Chancellor of the Annex and Cabal Therapy provides disruption and protection against opposing strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures before they can establish a defense.
